transcripts.text: What do you think about abortion?
I personally wouldn't do it, but I wouldn't restrict anyone.  I wouldn't tell anyone that they couldn't do it.
And one word, your thoughts on what you saw?
That was really sad.  It made me sad.
No.  I'm about to cry.  I'm about to cry.  I'm sorry.  No, it's because I'm, like, four months pregnant, so, like, seeing that was, like, really sad.
It's a tough subject to talk about and to watch.

I don't want to take anyone's rights away and say, like, oh, like, you can't have an abortion.  and so, like... I'm pro, like, I don't know.  I guess I'm in the middle, like, pro-choice and pro-life.  Like, I do respect everyone's choices.  It's just I personally, like, would never have an abortion.
Did you learn anything about the procedure that you didn't know before?
I didn't know that.  that's how, like, that was scary to me.  Like, I didn't know that.  that's how it went down.

So, yeah.  One of the things that you said was that you don't want to take people's rights away.  He came to the perspective, as an abortionist, he came to the perspective that he was taking people's rights away, the right to life.
I totally agree.  I don't know, it's such a difficult topic.
